content: Zoltan Toroczkai | People | Department of Physics and Astronomy | University of Notre Dame Home › Zoltan Toroczkai Zoltan Toroczkai Professor, Department of Physics & Astronomy Office384C Nieuwland Science HallNotre Dame, IN 46556Phone+1 574-631-2618Emailtoro@nd.edu http://www.nd.edu/~toro Concurrent Professor, Computer Science and EngineeringResearch InterestsProf. Toroczkai's work is in the general area of complex systems research, bringing and developing tools from mathematics, equilibrium and non-equilibrium statistical physics, nonlinear dynamics and chaos theory to bear on problems in network science, neuroscience, biophysics, fluid dynamics, processes in solids, social sciences and foundations of computing.Honors and ActivitiesAmerican Physical Society Fellow, 2012EducationM.Sc., Physics, Babes-Bolyai University, Cluj-Napoca, Romania, 1992 Ph.D., Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, VA, 1997Publications"Cortical High-Density Counterstream Architectures", N.T.
